text: {| align=right border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=4 class=toccolours width=300 style="margin: 0 0 1em 1em; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px #aaa solid" |+ style="margin-left: inherit; font-size: larger;" | El Marqués, Querétaro, Mexico |- | align="center" colspan="2" | {| style="background: none;" |align="center"|City Coat of Arms Coat of arms |} |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| Latitude || 20.31° N |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| Longitude || 100.09° W |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| Municipal president || Mario Calzada Mercado (PRI) |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| Area || 787.4 km² |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| Population (2010) || 116,458 |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| HDI (2000) || 0.7295 |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| Time zone (UTC) || -6 UTC CST |- |bgcolor=#E8E7DB| GDP (per capita) (2000) || US$4.515,00 |- | align="center" colspan="2" | {| style="background: none;" |align="center"|Official website: http://www.elmarques.gob.mx |} |} El Marqués is a municipality in the Mexican state of Querétaro. It receives its name from Juan Antonio de Urrutia y Arana, the Marquis of the Villa del Villar del Águila, who built the aqueduct that supplied water to Querétaro for centuries. Its seat is the city of La Cañada. It forms part of the metropolitan area of Querétaro and has many state-of-the- art industrial parks and Querétaro International Airport. Category:Populated places in Querétaro Category:Municipalities of Querétaro
title: El Marqués
